meanings.definition: To write more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outwrite her classmates in their writing assignments.
meanings.sent2: The author was able to outwrite all the other writers in the competition.
meanings.sent3: In the writing contest, she managed to outwrite everyone with her creative stories.
meanings.sent4: Her pen danced across the paper, outwriting all others with its graceful strokes.
meanings.sent5: With determination and skill, she aimed to outwrite any competition that came her way.

meanings.sent1: He hoped to outwrite his favorite author one day.
meanings.sent2: The young poet was determined to outwrite even the most experienced writers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lack of experience, he managed to outwrite the seasoned journalists with his fresh perspective.
meanings.sent4: Her words soared above the rest, outwriting any doubts about her talent.
meanings.sent5: With practice and dedication, he believed he could outwrite anyone who underestimated him.
